ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
I recognize when other people are feeling distressed without them having to tell me.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: I understand that everyone experiences suffering at some point in their lives. (Relating to other people)
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: When someone is going through a difficult time, I feel kindly towards them.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: When someone else is upset, I try to stay open to their feelings rather than avoid them.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: When others are struggling, I try to do things that would be helpful.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: I notice when others are feeling distressed.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: I understand that feeling upset at times is part of human nature. (Relating to other people)
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: When I hear about bad things happening to other people, I feel concern for their wellbeing.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: I stay with and listen to other people when they are upset even if it is hard to bear.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: When someone is going through a difficult time, I try to look after them.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: I am quick to notice early signs of distress in others.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: Like me, I know that other people also experience struggles in life. (Relating to other people)
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: When someone is upset, I try to tune in to how they are feeling.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: I connect with the suffering of others without judging them.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: When I see someone in need, I try to do what is best for them.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: I recognize signs of suffering in others.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: I know that we can all feel upset at times when we are wronged.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: I am sensitive to other people's distress.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: When someone else is upset, I can be there for them without feeling overwhelmed by their distress.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: When I see that someone is upset, I do my best to take care of them.
Notes: 1=Not at all true; 2=Rarely true; 3=Sometimes true; 4=Often true; 5=Always true

ElementDescription: Sussex-Oxford Compassion for Others Scale (SOCS-O) - Recognizing suffering subscale
Notes: Sum of 4 items socs_o1, 6, 11, 16

ElementDescription: Sussex-Oxford Compassion for Others Scale (SOCS-O) - Understanding the universality of suffering subscale
Notes: Sum of 4 items socs_o2, 7, 12, 17

ElementDescription: Sussex-Oxford Compassion for Others Scale (SOCS-O) - Feeling for the person suffering subscale
Notes: Sum of 4 items socs_o3, 8, 13, 18

ElementDescription: Sussex-Oxford Compassion for Others Scale (SOCS-O) - Tolerating the uncomfortable feelings subscale
Notes: Sum of 4 items socs_o4, 8, 14, 19

ElementDescription: Sussex-Oxford Compassion for Others Scale (SOCS-O) - Acting or being motivated to act to alleviate suffering subscale
Notes: Sum of 4 items socs_o5, 10, 15, 20

ElementDescription: Sussex-Oxford Compassion for Others Scale (SOCS-O) - Total score
Notes: Sum of items socs_o1-20
